reviewText:
5.5/10 - 70% Driving and Stunts - 30% Actual Construction

This game was just okay for me. I really enjoyed the other 3 or so bridge constructor games so that may have jaded my opinion a bit. The game is focused more on the driving and stunts than the actual bridge construction element. In this series I prefer the offerings completely focused on the construction element.

Overall, this reminds me more so of a phone app than a $10 game. It's pretty fun and if you like a challenging stunt/construction games this one will be for you! I'd personally check out the first Bridge constructer if you are looking for a good one.

Worth $3 like any other app-like game. It's good... but not amazing.

reviewText:
Game is just one big OK!
First the game title is completely tabula rasa, why would you call a game Bridge Constructor when there are no damn bridges.
It would be more appropriate something like a Trucks Stunts or Construction stunts...etc

Yes what separate this game from others of this type is that you actualy drive and perform stunts.
It has good tutorial so beginers should get an easy start, but after some 10ish levels it is more and more challenging.

Bridge Constructor Stunts is very decent casual game that you can play daily 30-40 min while having first coffe, at least I did, and enjoy it.
However I cant agree that it is worth 9,99 for what it has to offer, so my suggestion is to wait for at least 50% discount.

reviewText:
Bridge Constructor Stunts is a simple and fun game that challenges the player to create ramps and bridges to get through some extreme obsticles, the game does feel like direct port from a mobile game, but the developers at Clockstone has done a good job porting the game for PC.

There are times when I felt a little frustrated by the obsticles, but that didn't stop me from continuing playing, which is a good thing :). The game at the moment is a little out of my price range for a game of this type, especially when you can get the same game on the app store for a quarter of the price.

Watch my video for more details and you will get a better idea of the game, and decide for yourself what this game means to you :).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=liwUA9sQX_s

reviewText:
this game is pretty amusing.

the gameplay is better than any other bridge construction game simply because u can also drive the car yourself and dont have to watch it drive along the way u build.

the music is also pretty nice to listen to.

the only negative thing i have to say is that in the construct mode the camera is pretty hard to control

i give the game a 9/10

reviewText:
A Bridge / Ramp Building Stunt Physics Puzzle Gamehttps://youtu.be/wl9MjX0PT4M
+ Unlike in Bridge building games, you actually get to drive the vehicle and test your builds yourself
+ LOTS of unique stages with plenty of challenging obstacles to get by
+ Building ramps and adjusting the trajectory while keeping the build sturdy enough is a lot of fun
+ Great rock soundtrack
+ Very appealing arcade-like graphics / visuals
+ Physics-based weight to structures, ramps, and so fourth causing unexpected outcomes and destruction
+ Gamepad controls were fastic, which is surprising for a game that has a build/edit mode and driving mode

- I felt like the control when driving was somewhat limited as you mainly just press the gas or break or rotate in the air in a somewhat large truck. (Just a wild idea, but it would be awesome if another game like this was made but using hotwheel-like cars with hotwheel-like ramps and stunts at high-speed)

Overall it's a great bit of fun, and is certainly enjoyable if you like physics based puzzle games.

reviewText:
So Bridge Constructor Stunts is like Poly Bridge but with more stunts. And I for one quite enjoyed it! I've played through campaign 1 and 2 and it just gets better and more difficult with each level.

I also made a video, feel free to watch it if you want to!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5vErdUaMwQE

If you enjoy building bridges and try them out yourself then this is the game for you, the graphics aren't that new but the gameplay is smooth and very enjoyable!

I recommend this game, 8/10.

reviewText:
Pretty awesome. Kinda different from most bridge building games. It's like it's 50% bridge building game, 50% 'Hill Climb Racing' on Android. Also it's got some nice reggae in the main menu and some simple, but edgy rock music while playing and there's a lot of explosions. I like the style and how it's really energetic. It's like if Michael Bay made a bridge building game.

Price seems fair, comparable to most similar games, but unlike some of them it kept my attention for a good while. There were a few quirks, but nothing that really bothered. So yeah I'd say pick it up if it's your cup of tea :)

Full first impression video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CqLBuRowsqQ&ab_channel=OJJVZ

reviewText:
I know a lot of people are mixed on this game but I honestly enjoyed it. Being a hot blooded American patriot I felt like I could really hear the National Anthem playing every time my truck took off to soar like our nations bird, the glorious bald eagle. Only thing I was missin' was a big ol' American flag attached to the back of the truck that fluttered in the wind as I recreated Neil Armstrongs space shuttle take off in about 1 ton of pure hard workin' steel. I recommend this game as much as I recommend freedom

Oh and I did a lets play if you need more proof of this games greatness (American grunts not included)

reviewText:
For those who would like to see gameplay - https://youtu.be/quzDqFg8kk8

Bridge Constructor Stunts is actually a pretty fun game, though it’s not as satisfying as it could be. The game is plagued with a very slow tutorial, mediocre bridge construction, basic stunt car controls and has a UI and input options that don’t feel natural on the Mouse & Keyboard.

The levels are broken up into two stages, a build phase and a stunt phase. You see the level, have a limited amount of resources, maybe restrictions in where you can build, and your goal is to get your vehicle to the other side. You can do some pretty wacky things and you have a lot of options when it comes to how you can form shapes, but it just isn’t up to the quality of something like Poly Bridge.

On the other end we have the stunt portion, the bit where you get in your car and drive. Simple controls, back, forward and rotate, nothing special. It’s nice having a little bit control of these segments but they aren’t that interesting, I felt having an automatic system would have been just as enjoyable as I got more frustrating moments out of this phase than pleasure. Also there are some weird game mechanics, to pass some levels you need to collect stars on a level, or reach a certain score (by doing tricks and collecting stuff), I feel these should be optional as they aren’t that engaging and force you into certain structure builds and movements within the stunt car.

Overall it’s pretty unique and fun, but at the same time it’s nothing stellar. I have not finished the game yet, but from the looks of things there are 33 stages, not sure what you’re supposed to do after that. There’s a replay system but that’s about it when it comes to bonus features. Unless you really want to be able to build a bridge and ride it to I’d pass the game for now, but for $6 it’s pretty subjective.

reviewText: Very nice game! Cool and unique game-play!\nIt is fun to build the ramps and then stunt on them :-D

A different (but very fun!) take on the classic Bridge Builder series. This time around, the focus is more on completing various objectives within the levels and creating the missing roads to do just that, and less on How do I get a 30 ton truck over a wooden bridge" using my tiny budget.\nIt's challenging if you want to go for the achievements
date: but just playing a random level
recommended: raising that ramp just a tiny bit further and see how much we can hit is just what I like in a casual game."
